This classic tale has become an enduring symbol of American youth culture.
  * "Where the Red Fern Grows" (1961) directed by Alain Resnais and Jean-Luc Godard, is a classic tearjerker about two siblings who grow up together in a rural Mississippi town.   * "Louie" (N/As) directed by Mark Steven Johnson and Michael Brandner, is an action comedy about a young man named Louie Evans who becomes the hero of his own story as he goes on a quest to find his own red-bone hound hunting dogs.   * "Why Did I Get Married?" The film explores themes of marriage, love, compromise, and conflict resolution. This classic tale has become an enduring symbol of American youth culture.
